English.Text: The crew assembles a dozen hardy levers to free the ship. Flexible hickory planking is cut and reshaped into a wedges, before being inserted into the ice at intervals of five paces, until they surround the stern. On a count of three the men lift, and to their surprise so does the hull! Once it starts moving, there's no stopping it; and it clatters through all icy obstructions to the sea. Your sailors embrace, they have been very resourceful.
